User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:7.0a2) Gecko/20110708 Firefox/7.0a2
Build ID: 20110708121754

Steps to reproduce:

My problem pertains to both firefox 5.0 as well as Firefox 7.0 from the aurora ppa (I am running Ubuntu Natty (11.04)):

I try to enter my university mail (webmail.duth.gr), I get the "Untrusted Connection" message, which is OK cause the university does not use signed Certificates for secure connection. 

I choose "I understand the Risks"->"Add Exception"->"Get Certificate"


Actual results:

What should have happened is that when I choose "get certificate", the checkbox allowing me to permanently store the exception should be activated. 


Expected results:

The checkbox to permanently store exception does not get activated. 

Now, everytime I restart firefox (or manually clear entire history, everything including site preferences) I need to go through the exact same process.

I can only assume that this is due to the fact that in the privacy tab, I choose to delete the entire history (everything, site preferences etc.).

I understand that this might be an intentional choice from your side (If I choose to delete site preferences, the exception pertaining to the certificate of a specific site should be deleted).

If that is the case, I kindly suggest making a new entry in the list of what you want to delete from history named "Accepted Certificates" or something, so that a user can choose to delete site preferences, but not stored certificate exceptions...

WFM with:
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:8.0a1) Gecko/20110708 Firefox/8.0a1

Might be that your cert store is broken.

Try moving cert8.db and cert_override.txt out of your firefox profile while firefox is closed, and see if you can save the changes after that. (new ones will be generated automatically)
